Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or specific examples to back up the assertion that Obama refused to disclose some of his donors due to suspicion of foreign money.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Obama refused to disclose donors because there was suspicion of them being foreign sources of money into his campaign, without providing any evidence or context to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Obama campaign did not properly safeguard against illegal foreign donations in the run-up to the 2008 presidential election, as found by an Associated Press investigation.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which Obama refused to disclose donors, as it does not provide specific information on the circumstances or instances where this refusal occurred.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity of campaign finance laws and regulations, as it does not acknowledge the legal requirements and limitations on donor disclosure for independent groups and campaigns.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why Obama may have chosen not to disclose certain donors, such as legal limitations or privacy concerns.
